title: Are politicians the most intelligent people in the world? - Quora
tags: Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: To assume so would be folly. They are no better, no worse than anyone else, across the board, just average. That is the beauty, the miracle of America’s creation. Imagine if you can, a nation whose foundational principles could be based upon people of average intelligence, not only having a voice but the opportunity to participate, to be nominated and elected by citizens who truly feel a particular person’s heart is in the right place. And yet, here it is. Politics isn’t so much about IQ-intelligence as it is compassion, common sense, knowing right from wrong, curiosity and vision. Leadership is proven in only one way: by one’s exemplary life, not their IQ score. Problem solvers, true patriots, visionaries who lead their troops into battle and end wars are typically not those who wear an IQ banner on their chest as a false badge of courage. Rather, they are ordinary folks, caught up in extreme circumstances, who keep a cool head and by their actions prove worthy of earning the confidence and trust of others. Millions of graves are filled with such men and women. Similarly, one might ask: “Are Congressional Medal of Honor recipients the most intelligent people in the world?” “Are members of the press corps the most intelligent people in the world?” “Are American educators the most intelligent people in the world?” “Are those who try, fail, and by trying fail again, until eventually they become some of the most successful business people on earth, are these the most intelligent people in the world?” “Are ordinary, hard-working citizens the most intelligent people in the world?” And finally, ARE YOU, by your own thoughts, habits and actions, among the most intelligent people in the world? Let’s hope so.

No, the last research I have seen shows that actors are the smartest occupational group. They must memorize lines & they must change personalities & adjust on a dime to other people especially when they’re acting live on the stage. But successful politicians are almost by definition pretty good actors, so my hunch is that on average elected politicians have higher IQs than 100.

Politicians are intelligent, in the same way any other criminal is. They are Narccistic, greedy, self absorbed individuals who become rich off the backs of the poor and middle class Americans. Further more, Donald Trump is not a politician. Yes , he may be on the Narccistic side as well but you do not find him lining his pocket at the expence of American taxpayers. No matter whether you like him or not, he is not in the game for a lifetime prize of retirement and secret service protection.

Morally definitely NOT! But if you are asking in the context of intellectual capacity, then let’s say, once they decide to put away their greed, somehow yes. But only if you define intelligence as: “The capacity to bring you what you want in the shortest amount of time possible”. This could be because the politicians have lots of contacts to talented people and therefore (indirectly) unite many different qualities in one person. But he himself could rarely solve an open engineer problem for example (which would define the classical-scientifical intelligence the world’s most badass inventers and discoverers had). The politican’s main talent is high social and slightly above average general intelligence.

This must be intended as an ironic question. There are certain qualities necessary for an individual to be a successful politician. Being intelligent is not one of them. The qualities one needs are: Ability to appear convincing Loving the sound of their own voice Ability to appear honest and truthful Good sense of timing, especially political timing Physically presentable Confident - but not over-confident Ruthless Untrusting Ability to be superficial, saying a lot but little of substance Ability to handle the media

No. Politicians are typically above average in intelligence, but few of them display high achievements in the most demanding fields. If you want to find the most intelligent people, just examine the top performers in physics, cosmology, and mathematics. You will also find very bright people in other STEM fields. And, because of the statistical nature of intelligence, you will occasionally find a very bright person doing something that does not typically attract super-bright people.

Are politicians the most intelligent people in the world? Oh God help us - should this be a majority thought! Politicians are a random bunch. They tend to be generalists and so a big on popular (memetic) views. For example the idea that “they tend to be generalists and so big on popular views” is an example of me being generalist. Making sweeping statements that people want to hear. The point is that they really fall into the same distribution for intelligence that a sample from the national population would generate. Thus the majority would be …. average, a few would be real bright ( < 5% ) sparks and the some complete dimwidies (< 5%) .

Absolutely not. Politicians are the most ambitious people in the world but their intelligence is no better than anyone else. In some cases far less then the average American. All you have to do is listen to Bernie Sanders or AOC to realize this.

Absolutely not! An example is George Bush, who has on many occasions been shown to be thicker than two short planks! To qualify as “most”, one should use the words, deceitful, cunning, manipulative, greedy, avaricious, egotistical & psychopathic & sociopathic, which most politicians qualify as, including war criminals, but ones that will never face a court or be charged!

The most? No. Are some of them up there? For sure. Easiest way to think about is if only politicians win the biggest prizes for smarts in the world: McArthur Grant, Nobel Prizes, Pulitzer, Oscars, etc. And since the answer to most of those is no, then they can’t be since most other of our most talented people don’t think they are.

This would depend on what your idea of intelligence is. If being intelligent is about acquiring wealth and above all power, then yes. They are above all communicators and communication is not about what is said but about the way it is said. With regard to intelligence, politicians merely show us just how stupid the rest of us are but this does not mean they are by any means intelligent themselves!

Most definitely not. They are just the people who are interested in politics and want to work in the field. Their motivations can range from genuine concern and wanting to help people to simply wanting power or prestige.
No, but they often represent the most powerful monied interests. They have to be obedient to these interests in some way. They don’t necessarily have to be smart.
